availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, doctor. Kentucky native. Son of John Sterett and Sallie DeHaven Sterett. Married Celestia Sterett. Father of John Sterett, Charles Sterett, William L. Sterett, and Jennie Sterett. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hancock County from 1851 to 1853 and from 1857 to 1859. Doctor in Hancock County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved people in Hancock County in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 94; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Unnamed District, p. 8; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 2; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), 305; J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin. Kentucky: A History of the State 2nd Ed. (Louisville: F. A. Battey Publishing, 1885), 757-78.
